article.headline: 'You are so full of sh-': Billionaire Mark Cuban spars with Ted Cruz over NBA ratings
article.body: Mark Cuban at a Dallas Mavericks game. Christian Petersen/Getty Images “ 'You are so full of shit.' ” That's Mark Cuban, billionaire owner of the NBA's Dallas Mavericks, calling out Sen. Ted Cruz on Twitter TWTR, -0.23% for relishing in the poor ratings for this year's NBA Finals. iframe.twitter-tweet { width: 100% !important; } The NBA Finals this year between the Los Angeles Lakers and the Miami Heat have by various accounts struggled to attract viewers. Some factors may include, if not be limited to, the NBA's competing with NFL games for the first time and cable television's election focus. Republican Cruz, however, thinks it's because the NBA has turned "every game into a left-wing political lecture." See also: 'Everybody is struggling': How Olympic athletes are coping with Tokyo 2020 being postponed a year The NBA, who is playing this year's NBA Finals in the ESPN Wide World of Sports Complex in Walt Disney World Resort DIS, near Orlando, Fla., has painted the words "Black Lives Matter" on all the the courts. Various players and coaches have engaged in protests throughout their time in the NBA bubble, including kneeling during the national anthem and refusing to play several playoff games in the wake of the shooting of Jacob Blake in Wisconsin. iframe.twitter-tweet { width: 100% !important; } Cuban was quick to call out Cruz for rooting against a business that employs thousands of people in their shared home state of Texas. This is not the first time Cuban and Cruz have feuded on Twitter. Cuban once told Cruz to "have some balls for once."
